feed.title: Neko Diablo
feed.subtitle: Workshops in Portland, Oregon, where like-minded explorers can make memorable art and gifts together.

entry.title: Logo Design in Illustrator Series
entry.content:
Are you:

  • an artist, writer, or small business owner who wants full creative freedom to design his or her logo
  • needing to translate an existing drawn logo into a digital file
  • wanting to create a logo, but don’t know where to start
  • interested in learning about how to use Adobe Illustrator to create vector images
  • wanting to add Adobe Illustrator to your list of marketable skills

In this three (3) part series of workshops, you will learn how to use Adobe Illustrator to create your personal or business logo. Please note that you will need to do some preparation outside of the workshop time to create your logo in part two.

You will need access to Adobe Illustrator for these workshops. You can download a free trial here.

We will meet for three Saturdays from 1pm to 3pm. Interested, but this day/time does not work for you? Please tell us your availability.

Satisfaction Guarantee: We are confident that you will be pleased with the Logo Design in Illustrator Series; however, if at the end you are not completely satisfied, we offer you a nearly-full refund of $114 (less 5% processing fee).

You will learn:

Part 1 – Introduction to Illustrator Tools and Logo Creation Guide

Saturday, July 23, 2016  @  1pm - 3pm

  • What is a vector image
  • The selection, direct selection, pen, type, and various shape tools
  • Introduction to working with paths and anchor points
  • Working with artboards and layers
  • Modifying stroke type, width, and weight
  • Aligning and grouping objects
  • Learn about free resources to use in developing your logo such as free-for-commercial-use fonts
  • Logo best practices – how to create a memorable and succinct image that describes your business and translates well from small (e.g. business card) to large (e.g.billboard) applications.

Part 2 – Craft Your Logo (By Hand/Digitally)

Saturday, July 30, 2016  @  1pm - 3pm

  • Combine type and image to create several logo options
  • How to bring your image(s) into Illustrator
  • Continued exploration of paths: joining, pathfinder methods, and compound paths
  • Various transformation actions

Part 3 – Review Logos and Preparing Final Logo Files

Saturday, August 6, 2016  @  1pm - 3pm

  • Expand and expand appearance
  • Creating text outlines
  • Exporting your logo in different formats
  • Answer final questions

Before the First Workshop

Nada - just attend.

We look forward to meeting and making with you at the Logo Design in Illustrator Series of workshops.

Expand and expand appearance Creating text outlines Exporting your logo in different formats Answer final questions
Before the First Workshop
Nada - just attend.
We look forward to meeting and making with you at the Logo Design in Illustrator Series of workshops.

entry.title: Monogram Stamp & Stationary Workshop
entry.content:
Do you love the special touch of a handwritten note? Join us for an exploration of relief printing and build memorable cards and envelopes to showcase your personal writing.

You will explore:

  • Transferring images
  • How to use a linoleum cutter and carving techniques
  • Creating patterns/ornaments
  • Inking and applying rubber stamps

You will make / keep:

  • One mounted monogram stamp (~ 2 ¼ in. x 2 ¼ in.) with the letter(s) of your choice.
  • One large or a few mini stamps for ornament (unmounted).
  • A set of fifteen personalized stationary (cards and envelopes).
  • Stamp carving tool (Speedball No.1 Lino Cutter Assortment with five cutters.)

First, you’ll carve and mount your monogram stamp onto hard oak (note: not mounted in photos). Next, you’ll carve mini pattern stamps or a single ornament (unmounted) for your envelope. Finally, you’ll build your personalized set of stationary.

About the stationary: Fabriano Medioevalis Stationery is a magnificent, mouldmade paper with soft a white deckle-edged made in France at the Fabriano mill. The cards are 6 ¾ in. x 4 ½ in. and envelopes are 4 ¾ in. × 7 in. Cards are 260 gsm and envelopes are 120 gsm. The quality is superb!

Cost of Materials: $35

We recommend creating a single-initial monogram; the simplicity is elegant and you’ll be able to both carve the stamp and build your stationary within the workshop time. See below regarding letter choices:

Before the First Workshop

  • Choose a letter you would like to carve into a stamp. View our list of letter samples. Alternatively, you may find or create your own letter.
  • If you chose from our options above, please send us an email with your letter selection (e.g. A1, J6, etc.). If you did not select from the document above, please bring your chosen letter to the workshop. Make sure to draw or print a letter that fits within a 2 ¼ in. x 2 ¼ in. square to properly fit your carving block and card.

We will have the following Colorbox Pigment Stamp Pads available:

  • Canary
  • Scarlet
  • Peony
  • Royal Blue
  • Fresh Green
  • Cranberry
  • Heliotrope
  • Brown
  • Gold
  • Silver
  • Black
  • Sunflower
  • Aqua
  • Moss Green
  • Ruby
  • Robin’s Egg
  • Citrine
  • Mango Tango

We look forward to meeting and making with you at the Monogram Stamp & Stationary Workshop workshop.

entry.title: Intro to Adobe InDesign Series
entry.content:
Are you:

  • the person in your office responsible for creating posters, flyers, and other advertising and need to use InDesign
  • a writer and self-publisher who needs to typeset your work and automate page numbers, section markers, and table of contents
  • a small business owner or entrepreneur who needs to create professional documents and marketing materials
  • a current (or just beginning) digital scrapbooker who wants full creative freedom as you build your pages
  • looking to add Adobe InDesign to your list of marketable skills

This three (3) part series of workshops will be an introduction to the desktop publishing application Adobe InDesign.

You can download a free trial of Adobe InDesign here.

We will meet Mondays from 6pm to 8pm. Interested, but this day/time does not work for you? Please tell us your availability.

Satisfaction Guarantee: We are confident that you will be pleased with the Intro to Adobe InDesign Series; however, if at the end you are not completely satisfied, we offer you a nearly-full refund of $114 (less 5% processing fee).

You will learn:

Part 1 – Introduction to the InDesign Interface and Type and Image Editing

Monday, July 11, 2016  @  6pm - 8pm

  • InDesign general interface: workspaces, panels, tools, etc.
  • Document setup, margin, bleeds, pages, layers
  • Placing images and document links
  • Adding and manipulating text
  • Character and paragraph settings

Part 2 – Styles and Working with Large Bodies of Text

Monday, July 18, 2016  @  6pm - 8pm

  • Character and paragraph styles
  • Bullets and numbering
  • Grids, columns, and gutters
  • Threading text
  • Master pages, page numbering, section markers

Part 3 – Automation Features in InDesign and Review

Monday, July 25, 2016  @  6pm - 8pm

  • Data merge
  • Generating a table of contents
  • Review what we have covered and answer final questions

Before the First Workshop

Nada - just attend.

We look forward to meeting and making with you at the Intro to Adobe InDesign Series workshop.

entry.title: Intro to Web Design Series
entry.content:
Do you:

  • own a business and want to fully manage your own website
  • want to start a new hobby or blog
  • have content you want to publish online
  • want to add web design to your list of marketable skills

This seven (7) part series of workshops will be a web design fundamentals course focusing on HTML and CSS and will compliment your self-study/practice. You’ll learn new skills, discover free resources, ask questions, work on your projects, and create community. We will meet Thursdays from 6:30pm to 8:30pm. Interested, but this day/time does not work for you? Please tell us your availability.

Satisfaction Guarantee: We are confident that you will be pleased with the Intro to Web Design Series; however, if at the end you are not completely satisfied, we offer you a nearly-full refund of $285 (less 5% processing fee).

You will learn:

Part 1 – Introduction to the Web and Website Structure and Style

Thursday, July 7, 2016  @  6:30pm - 8:30pm

  • What is the web? How do websites work?
  • Introduction to the structure of a website: HTML
  • Introduction to the style of a website: CSS
  • Folders (directories), files, and absolute and relative links

Part 2 – Semantics and Selectors

Thursday, July 14, 2016  @  6:30pm - 8:30pm

  • HTML and semantics (Writing Descriptive HTML)
  • CSS specificity (More on CSS Declarations)

Part 3 – Getting Setup: Domain, Hosting, FTP, and Personalized Email

Thursday, July 21, 2016  @  6:30pm - 8:30pm

  • Domain registration
  • Hosting options
  • Transferring files to your web host
  • Establishing a custom email (yourname @ yourdomain.com) for FREE that you can access through gmail or other email client

Part 4 – The Box Model and Positioning

Thursday, July 28, 2016  @  6:30pm - 8:30pm

  • Learn how the box model and the position and float properties influence how content is displayed (more-in-depth CSS)

Part 5 – Not-from-Scratch HTML/CSS and Content Management with Blogging Platforms

Thursday, August 4, 2016  @  6:30pm - 8:30pm

  • Front-end templates and CSS Frameworks
  • Free content resources to add to your site: fonts and images
  • A brief overview of blogging platform options, including Wordpress, Tumblr, and Jekyll (This class does not teach how to use these platforms.)

Part 6 – Integrating Paypal, Social Media, and Google Analytics

Thursday, August 11, 2016  @  6:30pm - 8:30pm

  • Add Paypal buy now buttons
  • Links to facebook, instagram, twitter, etc.
  • Display social posts on your site
  • Integrating Google Analytics with your site

Part 7 – Putting It All Together

Thursday, August 18, 2016  @  6:30pm - 8:30pm

  • Final overview of what we have learned and where you can go next
  • Complete any unfinished topics and answer final questions
  • Review of resources and next steps to complete your project

Before the First Workshop

Nada - just attend.

We look forward to meeting and making with you at the Intro to Web Design Series workshop.
